10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques identified by a security control or finding.

status_detail.caption: Status Details
status_detail.description: The status details contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

duration.caption: Duration
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that triggered the event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: System Activity.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Kernel Activity.

proxy_endpoint.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: The responder (server) in a network connection.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not listed. The disposition attribute should be populated with a source specific caption.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A Class describes the attributes available in an event.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

process_activity.caption: Process Activity
process_activity.name: process_activity

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not listed. The disposition attribute should be populated with a source specific caption.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

12.caption: Partially Corrected

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not listed. The disposition attribute should be populated with a source specific caption.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

5.caption: Discovery
5.description: Discovery events report the existence and state of devices, files, configurations, processes, registry keys, and other objects.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Discovery.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Operating System Patch State.

patch_state.description: Operating System Patch State reports the installation of an OS patch to a device and any associated knowledgebase articles.

win/resource_activity.caption: Windows Resource Activity
win/resource_activity.name: resource_activity

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not listed. The disposition attribute should be populated with a source specific caption.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A Class describes the attributes available in an event.

201003.caption: Windows Resource Activity
201003.description: Windows Resource Activity events report when a process accesses a Windows managed resource object, successful or otherwise.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

win_resource.caption: Windows Resource
win_resource.description: The Windows resource object that was accessed, such as a mutant or timer.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques identified by a security control or finding.

status_detail.caption: Status Details
status_detail.description: The status details contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

duration.caption: Duration
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

1.caption: System Activity
1.description: System Activity events.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that triggered the event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: System Activity.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Windows Resource Activity.

win/resource_activity.description: Windows Resource Activity events report when a process accesses a Windows managed resource object, successful or otherwise.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.name: cvss
cvss.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) object provides a way to capture the principal characteristics of a vulnerability and produce a numerical score reflecting its severity.

depth.caption: CVSS Depth
depth.description: The CVSS depth represents a depth of the equation used to calculate CVSS score.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description:
The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) Qualitative Severity Rating. A textual representation of the numeric score.

CVSS v2.0
  • Low (0.0 – 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 – 6.9)
  • High (7.0 – 10.0)

CVSS v3.0
  • None (0.0)
  • Low (0.1 - 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 - 6.9)
  • High (7.0 - 8.9)
  • Critical (9.0 - 10.0)

base_score.caption: Base Score
base_score.description: The CVSS base score. For example: 9.1.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System metrics. This attribute contains information on the CVE's impact. If the CVE has been analyzed, this attribute will contain any CVSSv2 or CVSSv3 information associated with the vulnerability. For example: { {"Access Vector", "Network"}, {"Access Complexity", "Low"}, ...}.

overall_score.caption: Overall Score
overall_score.description: The CVSS overall score, impacted by base, temporal, and environmental metrics. For example: 9.1.

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

file.caption: File
file.name: file
file.description: The File object represents the metadata associated with a file stored in a computer system. It encompasses information about the file itself, including its attributes, properties, and organizational details. Defined by D3FEND d3f:File.

attributes.caption: Attributes
attributes.description: The bitmask value that represents the file attributes.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the file. For example: svchost.exe

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The user that owns the file/object.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The file type.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the file. For example: c:\windows\system32\svchost.exe.

signature.caption: Digital Signature
signature.description: The digital signature of the file.

modifier.caption: Modifier
modifier.description: The user that last modified the file.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product that created or installed the file.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the file, as returned by file system. For example: the description as returned by the Unix file command or the Windows file type.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the file as defined by the storage system, such the file system file ID.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

accessor.caption: Accessor
accessor.description: The name of the user who last accessed the object.

company_name.caption: Company Name
company_name.description: The name of the company that published the file. For example: Microsoft Corporation.

creator.caption: Creator
creator.description: The user that created the file.

mime_type.caption: MIME type
mime_type.description: The Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type of the file, if applicable.

parent_folder.caption: Parent Folder
parent_folder.description: The parent folder in which the file resides. For example: c:\windows\system32

accessed_time.caption: Accessed Time
accessed_time.description: The time when the file was last accessed.

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidentiality is not mapped. See the confidentiality attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the file was created.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the file was last modified.

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description:
An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

For example: Windows alternate data stream attributes (ADS stream name, ADS size, etc.), user-defined or application-defined attributes, ACL, owner, primary group, etc. Examples from DCS:

  • ads_name
  • ads_size
  • dacl
  • owner
  • primary_group
  • link_name - name of the link associated to the file.
  • hard_link_count - the number of links that are associated to the file.

accessed_time_dt.caption: Accessed Time
accessed_time_dt.description: The time when the file was last accessed.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the file was created.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the file was last modified.

group.caption: Group
group.name: group
group.description: The Group object represents a collection or association of entities, such as users, policies, or devices. It serves as a logical grouping mechanism to organize and manage entities with similar characteristics or permissions within a system or organization.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The group name.

type.caption: Account Type
type.description: The type of the group or account.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The domain where the group is defined. For example: the LDAP or Active Directory domain.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The group description.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the group. For example, for Windows events this is the security identifier (SID) of the group.

peripheral_device.caption: Peripheral Device
peripheral_device.name: peripheral_device
peripheral_device.description: The peripheral device object describes the identity, vendor and model of a peripheral device.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the peripheral device.

class.caption: Class
class.description: The class of the peripheral device.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the peripheral device.

authorization.caption: Authorization Result
authorization.name: authorization
authorization.description: The Authorization Result object provides details about the authorization outcome and associated policies related to activity.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the Identity/Access management policies that are applicable.

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.name: cwe
cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.

uid.caption: CWE ID
uid.description: The Common Weakness Enumeration unique number assigned to a specific weakness. A CWE Identifier begins "CWE" followed by a sequence of digits that acts as a unique identifier. For example: CWE-123.

caption.caption: Caption
caption.description: The caption assigned to the Common Weakness Enumeration unique identifier.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: URL pointing to the CWE Specification. For more information see CWE.

container.caption: Container
container.name: container
container.description: The Container object describes an instance of a specific container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The container name.

runtime.caption: Runtime
runtime.description: The backend running the container, such as containerd or cri-o.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the container image.

tag.caption: Image Tag
tag.description: The tag used by the container. It can indicate version, format, OS.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The full container unique identifier for this instantiation of the container. For example: ac2ea168264a08f9aaca0dfc82ff3551418dfd22d02b713142a6843caa2f61bf.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The container image used as a template to run the container.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Commit hash of image created for docker or the SHA256 hash of the container. For example: 13550340a8681c84c861aac2e5b440161c2b33a3e4f302ac680ca5b686de48de.

network_driver.caption: Network Driver
network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container. For example, bridge, overlay, host, none, etc.

orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, or OpenShift.

pod_uuid.caption: Pod UUID
pod_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the pod (or equivalent) that the container is executing on.

request.caption: Request Elements
request.name: request
request.description: The Request Elements object describes characteristics of an API request.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The additional data that is associated with the api request.

flags.caption: Flags
flags.description: The list of communication flags, normalized to the captions of the flag_ids values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique request identifier.

containers.caption: Containers
containers.description: When working with containerized applications, the set of containers which write to the standard the output of a particular logging driver. For example, this may be the set of containers involved in handling api requests and responses for a containerized application.

network_traffic.caption: Network Traffic
network_traffic.name: network_traffic
network_traffic.description: The Network Traffic object describes characteristics of network traffic. Network traffic refers to data moving across a network at a given point of time. Defined by D3FEND d3f:NetworkTraffic.

bytes_in.caption: Bytes In
bytes_in.description: The number of bytes sent from the destination to the source.

bytes_out.caption: Bytes Out
bytes_out.description: The number of bytes sent from the source to the destination.

chunks.caption: Chunks
chunks.description: The total number of chunks (in and out).

bytes.caption: Total Bytes
bytes.description: The total number of bytes (in and out).

chunks_in.caption: Chunks In
chunks_in.description: The number of chunks sent from the destination to the source.

chunks_out.caption: Chunks Out
chunks_out.description: The number of chunks sent from the source to the destination.

packets.caption: Total Packets
packets.description: The total number of packets (in and out).

packets_in.caption: Packets In
packets_in.description: The number of packets sent from the destination to the source.

packets_out.caption: Packets Out
packets_out.description: The number of packets sent from the source to the destination.

http_header.caption: HTTP Header
http_header.name: http_header
http_header.description: TThe HTTP Header object represents the headers sent in an HTTP request or response. HTTP headers are key-value pairs that convey additional information about the HTTP message, including details about the content, caching, authentication, encoding, and other aspects of the communication.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the header

epss.caption: EPSS
epss.name: epss
epss.description: The Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) object describes the estimated probability a vulnerability will be exploited. EPSS is a community-driven effort to combine descriptive information about vulnerabilities (CVEs) with evidence of actual exploitation in-the-wild. (EPSS).

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the EPSS model used to calculate the score.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The timestamp indicating when the EPSS score was calculated.

percentile.caption: EPSS Percentile
percentile.description: The EPSS score's percentile representing relative importance and ranking of the score in the larger EPSS dataset.

score.caption: EPPS Score
score.description: The EPSS score representing the probability [0-1] of exploitation in the wild in the next 30 days (following score publication).

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The timestamp indicating when the EPSS score was calculated.

endpoint_connection.caption: Endpoint Connection
endpoint_connection.name: endpoint_connection
endpoint_connection.description: The Endpoint Connection object contains information detailing a connection attempt to an endpoint.

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: A numerical response status code providing details about the connection.

network_endpoint.caption: Network Endpoint
network_endpoint.description: Provides characteristics of the network endpoint.

rpc_interface.caption: RPC Interface
rpc_interface.name: rpc_interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface represents the remote procedure call interface used in the DCE/RPC session.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the DCE/RPC protocol being used in the session.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The unique identifier of the particular remote procedure or service.

ack_reason.caption: Acknowledgement Reason
ack_reason.description: An integer that provides a reason code or additional information about the acknowledgment result.

ack_result.caption: Acknowledgement Result
ack_result.description: An integer that denotes the acknowledgment result of the DCE/RPC call.

kernel_driver.caption: Kernel Extension
kernel_driver.name: kernel_driver
kernel_driver.description: The Kernel Extension object describes a kernel driver that has been loaded or unloaded into the operating system (OS) kernel. Defined by D3FEND d3f:KernelModule.

win/reg_key.caption: Registry Key
win/reg_key.name: reg_key
win/reg_key.description: The registry key object describes a Windows registry key. Defined by D3FEND d3f:WindowsRegistryKey.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the registry key.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the registry key was last modified.

security_descriptor.caption: Security Descriptor
security_descriptor.description: The security descriptor of the registry key.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the registry key was last modified.

enrichment.caption: Enrichment
enrichment.name: enrichment
enrichment.description: The Enrichment object provides inline enrichment data for specific attributes of interest within an event. It serves as a mechanism to enhance or supplement the information associated with the event by adding additional relevant details or context.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The enrichment data associated with the attribute and value. The meaning of this data depends on the type the enrichment record.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the attribute to which the enriched data pertains.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The enrichment type. For example: location.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value of the attribute to which the enriched data pertains.

san.caption: Subject Alternative Name
san.name: san
san.description: The Subject Alternative name (SAN) object describes a SAN secured by a digital certificate

name.caption: Name
name.description: Name of SAN (e.g. The actual IP Address or domain.)

type.caption: Type
type.description: Type descriptor of SAN (e.g. IP Address/domain/etc.)

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.name: load_balancer
load_balancer.description: The load balancer object describes the load balancer entity and contains additional information regarding the distribution of traffic across a network.

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: The numeric response status code detailing the connection from the load balancer to the destination target.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The load balancer message.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the load balancer.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the load balancer.

classification.caption: Classification
classification.description: The request classification as defined by the load balancer.

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: The destination to which the load balancer is distributing traffic.

endpoint_connections.caption: Endpoint Connections
endpoint_connections.description: An object detailing the load balancer connection attempts and responses.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: General purpose metrics associated with the load balancer.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional status information about the load balancer distribution event.

device.caption: Device
device.name: device
device.description: The Device object represents an addressable computer system or host, which is typically connected to a computer network and participates in the transmission or processing of data within the computer network. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Host.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The most recent discovery time of the device.

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the endpoint.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The device type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the device was known to have been created.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The network domain where the device resides. For example: work.example.com.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit related to the device.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the device was last known to have been modified.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the device was last known to have been modified.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the device was known to have been created.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The image used as a template to run the virtual machine.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The initial discovery time of the device.

3.caption: Laptop
3.description: A laptop computer.

6.caption: Virtual
6.description: A virtual machine.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Server
1.description: A server.

2.caption: Desktop
2.description: A desktop computer.

10.caption: Switch
10.description: A networking switch.

5.caption: Mobile
5.description: A mobile phone.

7.caption: IOT
7.description: A IOT (Internet of Things) device.

8.caption: Browser
8.description: A web browser.

9.caption: Firewall
9.description: A networking firewall.

11.caption: Hub
11.description: A networking hub.

is_personal.caption: Personal Device
is_personal.description: The event occurred on a personal device.

imei.caption: IMEI
imei.description: The International Mobile Station Equipment Identifier that is associated with the device.

name.caption: Name
name.description:
The alternate device name, ordinarily as assigned by an administrator.

Note: The Name could be any other string that helps to identify the device, such as a phone number; for example 310-555-1234.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the device.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description: The initial discovery time of the device.

network_interfaces.caption: Network Interfaces
network_interfaces.description:
The network interfaces that are associated with the device, one for each unique MAC address/IP address/hostname/name combination.

Note: The first element of the array is the network information that pertains to the event.

hypervisor.caption: Hypervisor
hypervisor.description: The name of the hypervisor running on the device. For example, Xen, VMware, Hyper-V, VirtualBox, etc.

autoscale_uid.caption: Autoscale UID
autoscale_uid.description: The unique identifier of the cloud autoscale configuration.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description: The most recent discovery time of the device.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the device, ordinarily as reported by the operating system.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The device IP address, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the device belongs. For example: <code>["Windows Laptops", "Engineering"]<code/>.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the device. For example the Windows TargetSID or AWS EC2 ARN.

is_trusted.caption: Trusted Device
is_trusted.description: The event occurred on a trusted device.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

is_compliant.caption: Compliant Device
is_compliant.description: The event occurred on a compliant device.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

region.caption: Region
region.description: The region where the virtual machine is located. For example, an AWS Region.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

is_managed.caption: Managed Device
is_managed.description: The event occurred on a managed device.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: An alternate unique identifier of the device if any. For example the ActiveDirectory DN.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: The Metadata object describes the metadata associated with the event. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Metadata.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the OCSF schema, using Semantic Versioning Specification (SemVer). For example: 1.0.0. Event consumers use the version to determine the available event attributes.

extension.caption: Schema Extension
extension.description: The schema extension used to create the event.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product that reported the event.

uid.caption: Event UID
uid.description: The logging system-assigned unique identifier of an event instance.

extensions.caption: Schema Extensions
extensions.description: The schema extensions used to create the event.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description:
The list of category labels attached to the event or specific attributes. Labels are user defined tags or aliases added at normalization time.

For example: ["network", "connection.ip:destination", "device.ip:source"]

log_level.caption: Log Level
log_level.description: The audit level at which an event was generated.

sequence.caption: Sequence Number
sequence.description: Sequence number of the event. The sequence number is a value available in some events, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the event time precision.

profiles.caption: Profiles
profiles.description: The list of profiles used to create the event.

correlation_uid.caption: Correlation UID
correlation_uid.description: The unique identifier used to correlate events.

event_code.caption: Event Code
event_code.description: The Event ID or Code that the product uses to describe the event.

log_name.caption: Log Name
log_name.description: The event log name. For example, syslog file name or Windows logging subsystem: Security.

log_provider.caption: Log Provider
log_provider.description: The logging provider or logging service that logged the event. For example, Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing.

log_version.caption: Log Version
log_version.description: The event log schema version that specifies the format of the original event. For example syslog version or Cisco Log Schema Version.

logged_time.caption: Logged Time
logged_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

loggers.caption: Loggers
loggers.description: An array of Logger objects that describe the devices and logging products between the event source and its eventual destination. Note, this attribute can be used when there is a complex end-to-end path of event flow.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the event was last modified or enriched.

original_time.caption: Original Time
original_time.description: The original event time as reported by the event source. For example, the time in the original format from system event log such as Syslog on Unix/Linux and the System event file on Windows. Omit if event is generated instead of collected via logs.

processed_time.caption: Processed Time
processed_time.description: The event processed time, such as an ETL operation.

processed_time_dt.caption: Processed Time
processed_time_dt.description: The event processed time, such as an ETL operation.

logged_time_dt.caption: Logged Time
logged_time_dt.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the event was last modified or enriched.

email.caption: Email
email.name: email
email.description: The Email object describes the email metadata such as sender, recipients, and direction. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Email.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size in bytes of the email, including attachments.

uid.caption: Email UID
uid.description: The email unique identifier.

from.caption: From
from.description: The email header From values, as defined by RFC 5322.

cc.caption: Cc
cc.description: The email header Cc values, as defined by RFC 5322.

to.caption: To
to.description: The email header To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

subject.caption: Subject
subject.description: The email header Subject value, as defined by RFC 5322.

message_uid.caption: Message UID
message_uid.description: The email header Message-Id value, as defined by RFC 5322.

reply_to.caption: Reply To
reply_to.description: The email header Reply-To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

smtp_from.caption: SMTP From
smtp_from.description: The value of the SMTP MAIL FROM command.

smtp_to.caption: SMTP To
smtp_to.description: The value of the SMTP envelope RCPT TO command.

x_originating_ip.caption: X-Originating-IP
x_originating_ip.description: The X-Originating-IP header identifying the emails originating IP address(es).

email_auth.caption: Email Authentication
email_auth.name: email_auth
email_auth.description: The Email Authentication object describes the Sender Policy Framework (SPF), DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) and Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) attributes of an email.

spf.caption: SPF Status
spf.description: The Sender Policy Framework (SPF) status of the email.

dkim.caption: DKIM Status
dkim.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) status of the email.

dkim_domain.caption: DKIM Domain
dkim_domain.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signing domain of the email.

dkim_signature.caption: DKIM Signature
dkim_signature.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signature used by the sending/receiving system.

dmarc.caption: DMARC Status
dmarc.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) status of the email.

dmarc_override.caption: DMARC Override
dmarc_override.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) override action.

dmarc_policy.caption: DMARC Policy
dmarc_policy.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) policy status.

databucket.caption: Databucket
databucket.name: databucket
databucket.description: The databucket object is a basic container that holds data, typically organized through the use of data partitions.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The databucket name.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the databucket in bytes.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The databucket type.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the databucket.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the databucket.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the databucket belongs.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the databucket type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the databucket was known to have been created.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the databucket.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the databucket was known to have been created.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the databucket.

certificate.caption: Digital Certificate
certificate.name: certificate
certificate.description: The Digital Certificate, also known as a Public Key Certificate, object contains information about the ownership and usage of a public key. It serves as a means to establish trust in the authenticity and integrity of the public key and the associated entity. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Certificate.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the certificate.

fingerprints.caption: Fingerprints
fingerprints.description: The fingerprint list of the certificate.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the certificate was created.

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the certificate.

serial_number.caption: Certificate Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the certificate used to create the digital signature.

expiration_time_dt.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time_dt.description: The expiration time of the certificate.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the certificate was created.

network_interface.caption: Network Interface
network_interface.name: network_interface
network_interface.description: The Network Interface object describes the type and associated attributes of a network interface.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the network interface.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of network interface.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address associated with the network interface.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname associated with the network interface.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the network interface.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The MAC address of the network interface.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful in merger or acquisition situations. For example, when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

subnet_prefix.caption: Subnet Prefix Length
subnet_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length determines the number of bits used to represent the network part of the IP address. The remaining bits are reserved for identifying individual hosts within that subnet.

table.caption: Table
table.name: table
table.description: The table object represents a table within a structured relational database or datastore, which contains columns and rows of data that are able to be create, updated, deleted and queried.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The table name, ordinarily as assigned by a database administrator.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the data table in bytes.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the table.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the table.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the table belongs.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the table was known to have been created.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the table.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the table was known to have been created.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the table.

remediation.caption: Remediation
remediation.name: remediation
remediation.description: The Remediation object describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the remediation strategy.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of supporting URL/s, references that help describe the remediation strategy.

kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kb_article_list.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_article_list.description: A list of KB articles or patches related to an endpoint. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.name: malware
malware.description: The Malware object describes the classification of known malicious software, which is intentionally designed to cause damage to a computer, server, client, or computer network.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The malware name, as reported by the detection engine.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The filesystem path of the malware that was observed.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The malware unique identifier, as reported by the detection engine. For example a virus id or an IPS signature id.

classification_ids.caption: Classification IDs
classification_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers of the malware classifications. Reference: STIX Malware Types

classifications.caption: Classifications
classifications.description: The list of malware classifications, normalized to the captions of the classification_id values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

cves.caption: CVE List
cves.description: List of Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE).

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the malware information.

http_response.caption: HTTP Response
http_response.name: http_response
http_response.description: The HTTP Response object contains detailed information about the response sent from a web server to the requester. It encompasses attributes and metadata that describe the response status, headers, body content, and other relevant information.

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) status code returned from the web server to the client. For example, 200.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The response status. For example: A successful HTTP status of 'OK' which corresponds to a code of 200.

length.caption: Response Length
length.description: The HTTP response length, in number of bytes.

content_type.caption: HTTP Content Type
content_type.description: The request header that identifies the original media type of the resource (prior to any content encoding applied for sending).

http_headers.caption: HTTP Headers
http_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers of an HTTP request or response.

latency.caption: Latency
latency.description: The HTTP response latency measured in milliseconds.

organization.caption: Organization
organization.name: organization
organization.description: The Organization object describes characteristics of an organization or company and its division if any.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the organization. For example, Widget, Inc.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the organization. For example, its Active Directory or AWS Org ID.

ou_name.caption: Org Unit Name
ou_name.description: The name of the organizational unit, within an organization.  For example, Finance, IT, R&D

ou_uid.caption: Org Unit ID
ou_uid.description: The alternate identifier for an entity's unique identifier. For example, its Active Directory OU DN or AWS OU ID.

cis_benchmark_result.caption: CIS Benchmark Result
cis_benchmark_result.name: cis_benchmark_result
cis_benchmark_result.description: The CIS Benchmark Result object contains information as defined by the Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmark result. CIS Benchmarks are a collection of best practices for securely configuring IT systems, software, networks, and cloud infrastructure.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS benchmark name.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The CIS benchmark description.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

cis_benchmark.caption: CIS Benchmark
cis_benchmark.name: cis_benchmark
cis_benchmark.description: The CIS Benchmark object describes best practices for securely configuring IT systems, software, networks, and cloud infrastructure as defined by the Center for Internet Security. See also Getting to Know the CIS Benchmarks.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS Benchmark name. For example: Ensure mounting of cramfs filesystems is disabled.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The CIS Benchmark description. For example: The cramfs filesystem type is a compressed read-only Linux filesystem embedded in small footprint systems. A cramfs image can be used without having to first decompress the image.

cis_controls.caption: CIS Controls
cis_controls.description: The CIS Critical Security Controls is a prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors.

response.caption: Response Elements
response.name: response
response.description: The Response Elements object describes characteristics of an API response.

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: The numeric response sent to a request.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The additional data that is associated with the api response.

flags.caption: Flags
