flags.description: The list of communication flags, normalized to the captions of the flag_ids values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

containers.caption: Containers
containers.description: When working with containerized applications, the set of containers which write to the standard the output of a particular logging driver. For example, this may be the set of containers involved in handling api requests and responses for a containerized application.

image.caption: Image
image.name: image
image.description: The Image object provides a description of a specific Virtual Machine (VM) or Container image. Defined by D3FEND d3f:ContainerImage.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The image name. For example: elixir.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the image file.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique image ID. For example: 77af4d6b9913.

metric.caption: Metric
metric.name: metric
metric.description: The Metric object defines a simple name/value pair entity for a metric.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the metric.

extension.caption: Schema Extension
extension.name: extension
extension.description: The OCSF Schema Extension object provides detailed information about the schema extension used to construct the event. The schema extensions are registered in the extensions.md file.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The schema extension name. For example: dev.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The schema extension version. For example: 1.0.0-alpha.2.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The schema extension unique identifier. For example: 999.

reputation.caption: Reputation
reputation.name: reputation
reputation.description: The Reputation object describes the reputation/risk score of an entity (e.g. device, user, domain).

base_score.caption: Reputation Score
base_score.description: The reputation score as reported by the event source.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the reputation information.

score.caption: Reputation Score
score.description: The reputation score, normalized to the caption of the score_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

3.caption: Probably Safe
3.description: Reasonable history of good behavior.

6.caption: Exercise Caution
6.description: Starting to establish a history of suspicious or risky behavior.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The reputation score is not mapped. See the rep_score attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Very Safe
1.description: Long history of good behavior.

2.caption: Safe
2.description: Consistently good behavior.

10.caption: Malicious
10.description: Proven evidence of maliciousness.

4.caption: Leans Safe
4.description: Starting to establish a history of normal behavior.

5.caption: May not be Safe
5.description: No established history of normal behavior.

7.caption: Suspicious/Risky
7.description: A site with a history of suspicious or risky behavior. (spam, scam, potentially unwanted software, potentially malicious).

8.caption: Possibly Malicious
8.description: Strong possibility of maliciousness.

9.caption: Probably Malicious
9.description: Indicators of maliciousness.

package.caption: Software Package
package.name: package
package.description: The Software Package object describes details about a software package. Defined by D3FEND d3f:SoftwarePackage.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The software package name.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

epoch.caption: Epoch
epoch.description: The software package epoch. Epoch is a way to define weighted dependencies based on version numbers.

license.caption: Software License
license.description: The software license applied to this package.

architecture.caption: Architecture
architecture.description: Architecture is a shorthand name describing the type of computer hardware the packaged software is meant to run on.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

cis_csc.caption: CIS CSC
cis_csc.name: cis_csc
cis_csc.description: The CIS Critical Security Control (CSC) contains information as defined by the Center for Internet Security Critical Security Control (CIS CSC). Prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors.

control.caption: Security Control
control.description: A Control is prescriptive, prioritized, and simplified set of best practices that one can use to strengthen their cybersecurity posture. e.g. AWS SecurityHub Controls, CIS Controls.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CIS critical security control version.

process.caption: Process
process.name: process
process.description: The Process object describes a running instance of a launched program. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Process.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The friendly name of the process, for example: Notepad++.

pid.caption: Process ID
pid.description: The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user under which this process is running.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The group under which this process is running.

tid.caption: Thread ID
tid.description: The Identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier for this process assigned by the producer (tool).  Facilitates correlation of a process event with other events for that process.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The user session under which this process is running.

loaded_modules.caption: Loaded Modules
loaded_modules.description: The list of loaded module names.

cmd_line.caption: Command Line
cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10. If the command line is unavailable or missing, the empty string '' is to be used

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the process was created/started.

integrity.caption: Integrity
integrity.description: The process integrity level, normalized to the caption of the direction_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source (Windows only).

integrity_id.caption: Integrity Level
integrity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the process integrity level (Windows only).

lineage.caption: Lineage
lineage.description: The lineage of the process, represented by a list of paths for each ancestor process. For example: ['/usr/sbin/sshd', '/usr/bin/bash', '/usr/bin/whoami'].

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

parent_process.caption: Parent Process
parent_process.description: The parent process of this process object. It is recommended to only populate this field for the first process object, to prevent deep nesting.

sandbox.caption: Sandbox
sandbox.description: The name of the containment jail (i.e., sandbox). For example, hardened_ps, high_security_ps, oracle_ps, netsvcs_ps, or default_ps.

terminated_time.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time.description: The time when the process was terminated.

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description: An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs that represent a process extended attribute.

auid.caption: Audit User ID
auid.description: The audit user assigned at login by the audit subsystem.

euid.caption: Effective User ID
euid.description: The effective user under which this process is running.

egid.caption: Effective Group ID
egid.description: The effective group under which this process is running.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the process was created/started.

terminated_time_dt.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time_dt.description: The time when the process was terminated.

feature.caption: Feature
feature.name: feature
feature.description: The Feature object provides information about the software product feature that generated a specific event. It encompasses details related to the capabilities, components, user interface (UI) design, and performance upgrades associated with the feature.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the feature.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the feature.

dce_rpc.caption: DCE/RPC
dce_rpc.name: dce_rpc
dce_rpc.description: The DCE/RPC, or Distributed Computing Environment/Remote Procedure Call, object describes the remote procedure call system for distributed computing environments. Defined by D3FEND d3f:RemoteProcedureCall.

command_response.caption: Command Response
command_response.description: The reply to the request command (e.g. RESPONSE, BINDACK or FAULT).

opnum.caption: Opnum
opnum.description: An operation number used to identify a specific remote procedure call (RPC) method or a method in an interface.

rpc_interface.caption: Remote Procedure Call Interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface object describes the details pertaining to the remote procedure call interface.

cis_control.caption: CIS Control
cis_control.name: cis_control
cis_control.description: The CIS Control (aka Critical Security Control) object describes a prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors. The CIS Controls are defined by the Center for Internet Security.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS Control name. For example: 4.8 Uninstall or Disable Unnecessary Services on Enterprise Assets and Software.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CIS Control version. For example: v8.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The CIS Control description. For example: Uninstall or disable unnecessary services on enterprise assets and software, such as an unused file sharing service, web application module, or service function.

security_state.caption: Security State
security_state.name: security_state
security_state.description: The Security State object describes the security related state of a managed entity.

state.caption: Security State
state.description: The security state, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

state_id.caption: Security State ID
state_id.description: The security state of the managed entity.

3.caption: In network quarantine
3.description: Isolated from the network.

6.caption: Protection not licensed
6.description: The security solution does not have a valid license.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains data source specific values.

1.caption: Missing or outdated content
1.description: The content is missing or outdated.

2.caption: Policy mismatch
2.description: Not in compliance with the expected security policy.

10.caption: Content is locked
10.description: The content is locked to a specific version.

4.caption: Protection off
4.description: Not protected by a security solution.

5.caption: Protection malfunction
5.description: The security solution is not functioning properly.

7.caption: Unremediated threat
7.description: A detected threat has not been remediated.

8.caption: Suspicious reputation
8.description: Reputation of the entity is suspicious.

9.caption: Reboot pending
9.description: A reboot is required for one or more pending actions.

11.caption: Not installed
11.description: The entity is not installed.

14.caption: Failed boot verify
14.description: The device has failed the boot verification process.

15.caption: Modified execution environment
15.description: The execution environment has been modified.

16.caption: SELinux disabled
16.description: The SELinux security feature has been disabled.

17.caption: Elevated privilege shell
17.description: An elevated privilege shell has been detected.

18.caption: iOS file system altered
18.description: The file system has been altered on an iOS device.

20.caption: OTA updates disabled
20.description: Mobile OTA (Over The Air) updates have been disabled.

21.caption: Rooted
21.description: The device has been modified to allow root access.

22.caption: Android partition modified
22.description: The Android partition has been modified.

23.caption: Compliance failure
23.description: The entity is not compliant with the associated security policy.

12.caption: Writable system partition
12.description: The system partition is writeable.

13.caption: SafetyNet failure
13.description: The device has failed the SafetyNet check.

19.caption: Open remote access
19.description: Remote access is enabled.

network_proxy.caption: Network Proxy Endpoint
network_proxy.name: network_proxy
network_proxy.description: The network proxy endpoint object describes a proxy server, which acts as an intermediary between a client requesting a resource and the server providing that resource. Defined by D3FEND d3f:ProxyServer.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The short name of the endpoint.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The port used for communication within the network connection.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The network endpoint type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the endpoint, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the endpoint.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the endpoint.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the endpoint.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the endpoint.

3.caption: Laptop
3.description: A laptop computer.

6.caption: Virtual
6.description: A virtual machine.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Server
1.description: A server.

2.caption: Desktop
2.description: A desktop computer.

10.caption: Switch
10.description: A networking switch.

5.caption: Mobile
5.description: A mobile phone.

7.caption: IOT
7.description: A IOT (Internet of Things) device.

8.caption: Browser
8.description: A web browser.

9.caption: Firewall
9.description: A networking firewall.

11.caption: Hub
11.description: A networking hub.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

intermediate_ips.caption: Intermediate IP Addresses
intermediate_ips.description: The intermediate IP Addresses. For example, the IP addresses in the HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The network proxy information pertaining to a specific endpoint. This can be used to describe information pertaining to network address translation (NAT).

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

service.caption: Service
service.name: service
service.description: The Service object describes characteristics of a service, e.g. AWS EC2.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the service.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the service.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated with the service.

keyboard_info.caption: Keyboard Information
keyboard_info.name: keyboard_info
keyboard_info.description: The Keyboard Information object contains details and attributes related to a computer or device keyboard. It encompasses information that describes the characteristics, capabilities, and configuration of the keyboard.

function_keys.caption: Function Keys
function_keys.description: The number of function keys on client keyboard.

ime.caption: IME
ime.description: The Input Method Editor (IME) file name.

keyboard_layout.caption: Keyboard Layout
keyboard_layout.description: The keyboard locale identifier name (e.g., en-US).

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.name: http_request
http_request.description: The HTTP Request object represents the attributes of a request made to a web server. It encapsulates the details and metadata associated with an HTTP request, including the request method, headers, URL, query parameters, body content, and other relevant information.

args.caption: HTTP Arguments
args.description: The arguments sent along with the HTTP request.

length.caption: Request Length
length.description: The HTTP request length, in number of bytes.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the http request.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the request.

user_agent.caption: HTTP User-Agent
user_agent.description: The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

http_headers.caption: HTTP Headers
http_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers of an HTTP request or response.

http_method.caption: HTTP Method
http_method.description: The HTTP request method indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource.

OPTIONS.caption: Options
OPTIONS.description: The OPTIONS method describes the communication options for the target resource.

GET.caption: Get
GET.description: The GET method requests a representation of the specified resource. Requests using GET should only retrieve data.

HEAD.caption: Head
HEAD.description: The HEAD method asks for a response identical to a GET request, but without the response body.

POST.caption: Post
POST.description: The POST method submits an entity to the specified resource, often causing a change in state or side effects on the server.

PUT.caption: Put
PUT.description: The PUT method replaces all current representations of the target resource with the request payload.

DELETE.caption: Delete
DELETE.description: The DELETE method deletes the specified resource.

TRACE.caption: Trace
TRACE.description: The TRACE method performs a message loop-back test along the path to the target resource.

CONNECT.caption: Connect
CONNECT.description: The CONNECT method establishes a tunnel to the server identified by the target resource.

referrer.caption: HTTP Referrer
referrer.description: The request header that identifies the address of the previous web page, which is linked to the current web page or resource being requested.

x_forwarded_for.caption: X-Forwarded-For
x_forwarded_for.description: The X-Forwarded-For header identifying the originating IP address(es) of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy or a load balancer.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability Details
vulnerability.name: vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability is an unintended characteristic of a computing component or system configuration that multiplies the risk of an adverse event or a loss occurring either due to accidental exposure, deliberate attack, or conflict with new system components.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the discovered vulnerability.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the vulnerability.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the vulnerability.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The vendor assigned severity of the vulnerability.

affected_code.caption: Affected Code
affected_code.description: List of Affected Code objects that describe details about code blocks identified as vulnerable.

affected_packages.caption: Affected Software Packages
affected_packages.description: List of software packages identified as affected by a vulnerability/vulnerabilities.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE).

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The time when the vulnerability was first observed.

fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_exploit_available.caption: Exploit Availability
is_exploit_available.description: Indicates if an exploit or a PoC (proof-of-concept) is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
is_fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kb_article_list.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_article_list.description: A list of KB articles or patches related to an endpoint. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The time when the vulnerability was most recently observed.

packages.caption: Software Packages
packages.description: List of vulnerable packages as identified by the security product

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerabilities
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerabilities that are related to this vulnerability.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: The remediation recommendations on how to mitigate the identified vulnerability.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor that identified the vulnerability.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the vulnerability was first observed.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the vulnerability was most recently observed.

tls.caption: Transport Layer Security (TLS)
tls.name: tls
tls.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) object describes the negotiated TLS protocol used for secure communications over an establish network connection.

alert.caption: Client TLS Alert
alert.description: The integer value of TLS alert if present. The alerts are defined in the TLS specification in RFC-2246.

key_length.caption: Key Length
key_length.description: The length of the encryption key.

certificate.caption: Certificate
certificate.description: The certificate object containing information about the digital certificate.

sni.caption: Server Name Indication
sni.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) extension sent by the client.

certificate_chain.caption: Certificate Chain
certificate_chain.description: The Chain of Certificate Serial Numbers field provides a chain of Certificate Issuer Serial Numbers leading to the Root Certificate Issuer.

client_ciphers.caption: Client Cipher Suites
client_ciphers.description: The client cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.

handshake_dur.caption: Handshake Duration
handshake_dur.description: The amount of total time for the TLS handshake to complete after the TCP connection is established, including client-side delays, in milliseconds.

ja3_hash.caption: JA3 Hash
ja3_hash.description: The MD5 hash of a JA3 string.

ja3s_hash.caption: JA3S Hash
ja3s_hash.description: The MD5 hash of a JA3S string.

sans.caption: Subject Alternative Names
sans.description: The list of subject alternative names that are secured by a specific certificate.

server_ciphers.caption: Server Cipher Suites
server_ciphers.description: The server cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.

tactic.caption: Tactic
tactic.name: tactic
tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The tactic name that is associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: Reconnaissance.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The tactic ID that is associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: TA0043.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the attack tactic, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/tactics/TA0043/.

dns_answer.caption: DNS Answer
dns_answer.name: dns_answer
dns_answer.description: The DNS Answer object represents a specific response provided by the Domain Name System (DNS) when querying for information about a domain or performing a DNS operation. It encapsulates the relevant details and data returned by the DNS server in response to a query.

flags.caption: DNS Header Flags
flags.description: The list of DNS answer header flags.

type.caption: Resource Record Type
type.description: The type of data contained in this resource record. See RFC1035. For example: CNAME.

ttl.caption: TTL
ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.

class.caption: Resource Record Class
class.description: The class of DNS data contained in this resource record. See RFC1035. For example: IN.

flag_ids.caption: DNS Header Flags
flag_ids.description: The list of DNS answer header flag IDs.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event DNS header flag is not mapped.

packet_uid.caption: Packet UID
packet_uid.description: The DNS packet identifier assigned by the program that generated the query. The identifier is copied to the response.

rdata.caption: DNS RData
rdata.description: The data describing the DNS resource. The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.name: location
location.description: The Geo Location object describes a geographical location, usually associated with an IP address. Defined by D3FEND d3f:PhysicalLocation.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the geographical location.

country.caption: Country
country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. For the complete list of country codes see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

coordinates.caption: Coordinates
coordinates.description: A two-element array, containing a longitude/latitude pair. The format conforms with GeoJSON. For example: [-73.983, 40.719].

is_on_premises.caption: On Premises
is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.

isp.caption: ISP
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the geographical location data.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The alphanumeric code that identifies the principal subdivision (e.g. province or state) of the country. Region codes are defined at ISO 3166-2 and have a limit of three characters. For example, see the region codes for the US.

endpoint.caption: Endpoint
endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.description: The Endpoint object describes a physical or virtual device that connects to and exchanges information with a computer network. Some examples of endpoints are mobile devices, desktop computers, virtual machines, embedded devices, and servers. Internet-of-Things devices—like cameras, lighting, refrigerators, security systems, smart speakers, and thermostats—are also endpoints.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The short name of the endpoint.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The endpoint type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the endpoint, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the endpoint.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the endpoint.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the endpoint.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the endpoint.

3.caption: Laptop
3.description: A laptop computer.

6.caption: Virtual
6.description: A virtual machine.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Server
1.description: A server.

2.caption: Desktop
2.description: A desktop computer.

10.caption: Switch
10.description: A networking switch.

5.caption: Mobile
5.description: A mobile phone.

7.caption: IOT
7.description: A IOT (Internet of Things) device.

8.caption: Browser
8.description: A web browser.

9.caption: Firewall
9.description: A networking firewall.

11.caption: Hub
11.description: A networking hub.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

ldap_person.caption: LDAP Person
ldap_person.name: ldap_person
ldap_person.description: The additional LDAP attributes that describe a person.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location associated with a user. This is typically the user's usual work location.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The labels associated with the user. For example in AD this could be the userType, employeeType. For example: Member, Employee.

manager.caption: Manager
manager.description: The user's manager. This helps in understanding an org hierarchy. This should only ever be populated once in an event. I.e. there should not be a manager's manager in an event.

cost_center.caption: Cost Center
cost_center.description: The cost center associated with the user.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The timestamp when the user was created.

deleted_time.caption: Deleted Time
deleted_time.description: The timestamp when the user was deleted. In Active Directory (AD), when a user is deleted they are moved to a temporary container and then removed after 30 days. So, this field can be populated even after a user is deleted for the next 30 days.

email_addrs.caption: Email Addresses
email_addrs.description: A list of additional email addresses for the user.

employee_uid.caption: Employee ID
employee_uid.description: The employee identifier assigned to the user by the organization.

given_name.caption: Given Name
given_name.description: The given or first name of the user.

hire_time.caption: Hire Time
hire_time.description: The timestamp when the user was or will be hired by the organization.

last_login_time.caption: Last Login
last_login_time.description: The last time when the user logged in.

ldap_cn.caption: LDAP Common Name
ldap_cn.description: The LDAP and X.500 commonName attribute, typically the full name of the person. For example, John Doe.

ldap_dn.caption: LDAP Distinguished Name
ldap_dn.description: The X.500 Distinguished Name (DN) is a structured string that uniquely identifies an entry, such as a user, in an X.500 directory service For example, cn=John Doe,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com.

leave_time.caption: Leave Time
leave_time.description: The timestamp when the user left or will be leaving the organization.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The timestamp when the user entry was last modified.

office_location.caption: Office Location
office_location.description: The primary office location associated with the user. This could be any string and isn't a specific address. For example, South East Virtual.

surname.caption: Surname
surname.description: The last or family name for the user.

deleted_time_dt.caption: Deleted Time
deleted_time_dt.description: The timestamp when the user was deleted. In Active Directory (AD), when a user is deleted they are moved to a temporary container and then removed after 30 days. So, this field can be populated even after a user is deleted for the next 30 days.

leave_time_dt.caption: Leave Time
leave_time_dt.description: The timestamp when the user left or will be leaving the organization.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The timestamp when the user was created.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The timestamp when the user entry was last modified.

last_login_time_dt.caption: Last Login
last_login_time_dt.description: The last time when the user logged in.

hire_time_dt.caption: Hire Time
hire_time_dt.description: The timestamp when the user was or will be hired by the organization.

sub_technique.caption: Sub Technique
sub_technique.name: sub_technique
sub_technique.description: The Sub Technique object describes the sub technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: Scanning IP Blocks.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: T1595.001.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/techniques/T1595/001/.

idp.caption: Identity Provider
idp.name: idp
idp.description: The Identity Provider object contains detailed information about a provider responsible for creating, maintaining, and managing identity information while offering authentication services to applications. An Identity Provider (IdP) serves as a trusted authority that verifies the identity of users and issues authentication tokens or assertions to enable secure access to applications or services.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the identity provider.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the identity provider.

object.caption: Object
object.name: object
object.description: An unordered collection of attributes. It defines a set of attributes available in all objects. It can be also used as a generic object to log objects that are not otherwise defined by the schema.

job.caption: Job
job.name: job
job.description: The Job object provides information about a scheduled job or task, including its name, command line, and state. It encompasses attributes that describe the properties and status of the scheduled job.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the job.

file.caption: File
file.description: The file that pertains to the job.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that created the job.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the job.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the job was created.

last_run_time.caption: Last Run
last_run_time.description: The time when the job was last run.

next_run_time.caption: Next Run
next_run_time.description: The time when the job will next be run.

run_state.caption: Run State
run_state.description: The run state of the job.

run_state_id.caption: Run State ID
run_state_id.description: The run state ID of the job.

next_run_time_dt.caption: Next Run
next_run_time_dt.description: The time when the job will next be run.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the job was created.

last_run_time_dt.caption: Last Run
last_run_time_dt.description: The time when the job was last run.

display.caption: Display
display.name: display
display.description: The Display object contains information about the physical or virtual display connected to a computer system.

physical_height.caption: Physical Height
physical_height.description: The numeric physical height of display.

physical_orientation.caption: Physical Orientation
physical_orientation.description: The numeric physical orientation of display.

physical_width.caption: Physical Width
physical_width.description: The numeric physical width of display.

scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor
scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.

os.caption: Operating System (OS)
os.name: os
os.description: The Operating System (OS) object describes characteristics of an OS, such as Linux or Windows. Defined by D3FEND d3f:OperatingSystem.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The operating system name.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the operating system.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the OS running on the device that originated the event. For example: "Windows 10", "OS X 10.7", or "iOS 9".

country.caption: Country
country.description: The operating system country code, as defined by the ISO 3166-1 standard (Alpha-2 code). For the complete list of country codes, see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type identifier of the operating system.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

cpu_bits.caption: CPU Bits
cpu_bits.description: The cpu architecture, the number of bits used for addressing in memory. For example: 32 or 64.

edition.caption: OS Edition
edition.description: The operating system edition. For example: Professional.

sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

hassh.caption: HASSH
hassh.name: hassh
hassh.description: The HASSH object contains SSH network fingerprinting values for specific client/server implementations. It provides a standardized way of identifying and categorizing SSH connections based on their unique characteristics and behavior.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The concatenation of key exchange, encryption, authentication and compression algorithms (separated by ';'). NOTE: This is not the underlying algorithm for the hash implementation.

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint
fingerprint.description: The hash of the key exchange, encryption, authentication and compression algorithms.

session.caption: Session
session.name: session
session.description: The Session object describes details about an authenticated session. e.g. Session Creation Time, Session Issuer. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Session.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of identical sessions spawned from the same source IP, destination IP, application, and content/threat type seen over a period of time.

terminal.caption: Terminal
terminal.description: The Pseudo Terminal associated with the session. Ex: the tty or pts value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the session.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the session.

issuer.caption: Issuer Details
issuer.description: The identifier of the session issuer.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the session was created.

credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID
credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

expiration_reason.caption: Expiration Reason
expiration_reason.description: The reason which triggered the session expiration.

is_mfa.caption: Multi Factor Authentication
is_mfa.description: Indicates whether Multi Factor Authentication was used during authentication.

is_remote.caption: Remote
is_remote.description: The indication of whether the session is remote.

is_vpn.caption: VPN Session
is_vpn.description: The indication of whether the session is a VPN session.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier of the session. e.g. AWS ARN - arn:aws:sts::123344444444:assumed-role/Admin/example-session.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the session was created.

device_hw_info.caption: Device Hardware Info
device_hw_info.name: device_hw_info
device_hw_info.description: The Device Hardware Information object contains details and specifications of the physical components that make up a device. This information provides an overview of the hardware capabilities, configuration, and characteristics of the device.

bios_ver.caption: BIOS Version
bios_ver.description: The BIOS version. For example: LENOVO G5ETA2WW (2.62).

chassis.caption: Chassis
chassis.description: The chassis type describes the system enclosure or physical form factor. Such as the following examples for Windows Windows Chassis Types

cpu_bits.caption: CPU Bits
cpu_bits.description: The cpu architecture, the number of bits used for addressing in memory. For example: 32 or 64.

cpu_cores.caption: CPU Cores
cpu_cores.description: The number of processor cores in all installed processors. For Example: 42.

cpu_count.caption: CPU Count
cpu_count.description: The number of physical processors on a system. For example: 1.

cpu_speed.caption: Processor Speed
cpu_speed.description: The speed of the processor in Mhz. For Example: 4200.

cpu_type.caption: Processor Type
cpu_type.description: The processor type. For example: x86 Family 6 Model 37 Stepping 5.

desktop_display.caption: Desktop Display
desktop_display.description: The desktop display affiliated with the event

ram_size.caption: RAM Size
ram_size.description: The total amount of installed RAM, in Megabytes. For example: 2048.

observable.caption: Observable
observable.name: observable
observable.description: The observable object is a pivot element that contains related information found in many places in the event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The full name of the observable attribute. The name is a pointer/reference to an attribute within the event data. For example: file.name.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The observable value type name.

value.caption: Value
value.description:
The value associated with the observable attribute. The meaning of the value depends on the observable type.
If the name refers to a scalar attribute, then the value is the value of the attribute.
If the name refers to an object attribute, then the value is not populated.

3.caption: MAC Address (Dictionary Type)
3.description: Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example: 18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

6.caption: URL String (Dictionary Type)
6.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The observable data type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain data source specific value.

1.caption: Hostname (Dictionary Type)
1.description: Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. A domain name in general is an Internet address that can be resolved through the Domain Name System (DNS). For example: r2-d2.example.com.

2.caption: IP Address (Dictionary Type)
2.description: Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example, 192.168.200.24 or 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

10.caption: Resource UID (Dictionary Type)
10.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

5.caption: Email Address (Dictionary Type)
5.description: Email address. For example: john_doe@example.com.

7.caption: File Name (Dictionary Type)
7.description: File name. For example: text-file.txt.

8.caption: Hash (Dictionary Type)
8.description: Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

9.caption: Process Name (Dictionary Type)
9.description: Process name. For example: Notepad.

20.caption: Endpoint (Object)
20.description: The Endpoint object describes a physical or virtual device that connects to and exchanges information with a computer network. Some examples of endpoints are mobile devices, desktop computers, virtual machines, embedded devices, and servers. Internet-of-Things devices—like cameras, lighting, refrigerators, security systems, smart speakers, and thermostats—are also endpoints.

21.caption: User (Object)
21.description: The User object describes the characteristics of a user/person or a security principal. Defined by D3FEND d3f:UserAccount.

22.caption: Email (Object)
22.description: The Email object describes the email metadata such as sender, recipients, and direction. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Email.

23.caption: Uniform Resource Locator (Object)
23.description: The Uniform Resource Locator(URL) object describes the characteristics of a URL. Defined in RFC 1738 and by D3FEND d3f:URL.

24.caption: File (Object)
24.description: The File object represents the metadata associated with a file stored in a computer system. It encompasses information about the file itself, including its attributes, properties, and organizational details. Defined by D3FEND d3f:File.

25.caption: Process (Object)
25.description: The Process object describes a running instance of a launched program. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Process.

26.caption: Geo Location (Object)
26.description: The Geo Location object describes a geographical location, usually associated with an IP address. Defined by D3FEND d3f:PhysicalLocation.

27.caption: Container (Object)
27.description: The Container object describes an instance of a specific container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

29.caption: Registry Value (Object)
29.description: The registry value object describes a Windows registry value.

30.caption: Fingerprint (Object)
30.description: The Fingerprint object provides detailed information about a digital fingerprint, which is a compact representation of data used to identify a longer piece of information, such as a public key or file content. It contains the algorithm and value of the fingerprint, enabling efficient and reliable identification of the associated data.

28.caption: Registry Key (Object)
28.description: The registry key object describes a Windows registry key. Defined by D3FEND d3f:WindowsRegistryKey.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Contains the original and normalized reputation scores.

url.caption: Uniform Resource Locator
url.name: url
url.description: The Uniform Resource Locator(URL) object describes the characteristics of a URL. Defined in RFC 1738 and by D3FEND d3f:URL.

scheme.caption: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: http, https, ftp, or sftp.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The URL path as extracted from the URL. For example: /download/trouble from www.example.com/download/trouble.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The URL host as extracted from the URL. For example: www.example.com from www.example.com/download/trouble.

query_string.caption: HTTP Query String
query_string.description: The query portion of the URL. For example: the query portion of the URL http://www.example.com/search?q=bad&sort=date is q=bad&sort=date.

categories.caption: Website Categorization
categories.description: The Website categorization names, as defined by category_ids enum values.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The Domain/URL category is not mapped. See the categories attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

resource_type.caption: Resource Type
resource_type.description: The context in which a resource was retrieved in a web request.

subdomain.caption: Subdomain
subdomain.description: The subdomain portion of the URL. For example: sub in https://sub.example.com or sub2.sub1 in https://sub2.sub1.example.com.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL string. See RFC 1738. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe. Note: The URL path should not populate the URL string.

affected_code.caption: Affected Code
affected_code.name: affected_code
affected_code.description: The Affected Code object describes details about a code block identified as vulnerable.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: Details about the user that owns the affected file.

file.caption: File
file.description: Details about the file that contains the affected code block.

end_line.caption: End Line
end_line.description: The line number of the last line of code block identified as vulnerable.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

start_line.caption: Start Line
start_line.description: The line number of the first line of code block identified as vulnerable.

affected_package.caption: Affected Software Package
affected_package.name: affected_package
affected_package.description: The Affected Package object describes details about a software package identified as affected by a vulnerability/vulnerabilities.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The software package name.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The installation path of the affected package.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

epoch.caption: Epoch
epoch.description: The software package epoch. Epoch is a way to define weighted dependencies based on version numbers.

license.caption: Software License
license.description: The software license applied to this package.

architecture.caption: Architecture
architecture.description: Architecture is a shorthand name describing the type of computer hardware the packaged software is meant to run on.

fixed_in_version.caption: Fixed In Version
fixed_in_version.description: The software package version in which a reported vulnerability was patched/fixed.

package_manager.caption: Package Manager
package_manager.description: The software packager manager utilized to manage a package on a system, e.g. npm, yum, dpkg etc.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

http_cookie.caption: HTTP Cookie
http_cookie.name: http_cookie
http_cookie.description: The HTTP Cookie object, also known as a web cookie or browser cookie, contains details and values pertaining to a small piece of data that a server sends to a user's web browser. This data is then stored by the browser and sent back to the server with subsequent requests, allowing the server to remember and track certain information about the user's browsing session or preferences.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The HTTP cookie name.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The path of the HTTP cookie.

secure.caption: Secure
secure.description: The cookie attribute to only send cookies to the server with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol.

http_only.caption: HTTP Only
http_only.description: A cookie attribute to make it inaccessible via JavaScript

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the HTTP cookie.

is_http_only.caption: HTTP Only
is_http_only.description: This attribute prevents the cookie from being accessed via JavaScript.

is_secure.caption: Secure
is_secure.description: The cookie attribute indicates that cookies are sent to the server only when the request is encrypted using the HTTPS protocol.

samesite.caption: SameSite
samesite.description: The cookie attribute that lets servers specify whether/when cookies are sent with cross-site requests. Values are: Strict, Lax or None

expiration_time_dt.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time_dt.description: The expiration time of the HTTP cookie.

product.caption: Product
product.name: product
product.description: The Product object describes characteristics of a software product.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the product.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the product, as defined by the event source. For example: 2013.1.3-beta.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The installation path of the product.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the product.

feature.caption: Feature
feature.description: The feature that reported the event.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL pointing towards the product.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor of the product.

kernel.caption: Kernel Resource
kernel.name: kernel
kernel.description: The Kernel Resource object provides information about a specific kernel resource, including its name and type. It describes essential attributes associated with a resource managed by the kernel of an operating system. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Kernel.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the kernel resource.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the kernel resource.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path of the kernel resource.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type of the kernel resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

system_call.caption: System Call
system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.

compliance.caption: Compliance
compliance.name: compliance
compliance.description: The Compliance object contains information about Industry and Regulatory Framework standards, controls and requirements.

control.caption: Security Control
control.description: A Control is prescriptive, prioritized, and simplified set of best practices that one can use to strengthen their cybersecurity posture. e.g. AWS SecurityHub Controls, CIS Controls.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The resultant status of the compliance check normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

requirements.caption: Compliance Requirements
requirements.description: A list of requirements associated to a specific control in an industry or regulatory framework. e.g. NIST.800-53.r5 AU-10

standards.caption: Security Standards
standards.description: Security standards are a set of criteria organizations can follow to protect sensitive and confidential information. e.g. NIST SP 800-53, CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0, ISO/IEC 27001

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description: The resultant status code of the compliance check.

status_detail.caption: Status Details
status_detail.description: The contextual description of the status, status_code values.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the compliance check.

3.caption: Fail
3.description: The compliance check failed for at least one of the evaluated resources.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Pass
1.description: The compliance check passed for all the evaluated resources.

2.caption: Warning
2.description: The compliance check did not yield a result due to missing information.

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint
fingerprint.name: fingerprint
fingerprint.description: The Fingerprint object provides detailed information about a digital fingerprint, which is a compact representation of data used to identify a longer piece of information, such as a public key or file content. It contains the algorithm and value of the fingerprint, enabling efficient and reliable identification of the associated data.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The hash algorithm used to create the digital fingerprint, normalized to the caption of 'algorithm_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

algorithm_id.caption: Algorithm ID
algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized hash algorithm, which was used to create the digital fingerprint.

3.caption: SHA-256
3.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 256-bit (32-byte) hash value.

6.caption: TLSH
6.description: The TLSH fuzzy hashing algorithm.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The algorithm is not mapped. See the algorithm attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: MD5
1.description: MD5 message-digest algorithm producing a 128-bit (16-byte) hash value.

2.caption: SHA-1
2.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 1 producing a 160-bit (20-byte) hash value.

4.caption: SHA-512
4.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 512-bit (64-byte) hash value.

5.caption: CTPH
5.description: The ssdeep generated fuzzy checksum. Also known as Context Triggered Piecewise Hash (CTPH).

7.caption: quickXorHash
7.description: Microsoft simple non-cryptographic hash algorithm that works by XORing the bytes in a circular-shifting fashion.

win/reg_value.caption: Registry Value
win/reg_value.name: reg_value
win/reg_value.description: The registry value object describes a Windows registry value.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The data of the registry value.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the registry value.

type.caption: Type
type.description: A string representation of the value type as specified in Registry Value Types.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the registry key, where the value is located.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

is_default.caption: Default Value
is_default.description: The indication of whether the value is from a default value name. For example, the value name could be missing.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

win/win_resource.caption: Windows Resource
win/win_resource.name: win_resource
win/win_resource.description: The Windows resource object describes a resource object managed by Windows, such as mutant or timer.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the resource object.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the Windows resource object.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The Windows provided handle identifier for the resource object

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels/tags associated to a resource.

details.caption: Details
details.description: The string detailing the attributes of the resource object.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of the Windows resource object accessed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The resource object type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The resource object type is unknown.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The Windows service acting as the object server for the resource object, such as Security or Security Account Manager.

attack.caption: MITRE ATT&CK®
attack.name: attack
attack.description: The MITRE ATT&CK® object describes the tactic, technique & sub-technique associated to an attack as defined in ATT&CK MatrixTM.

tactics.caption: Tactics
tactics.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or tactic name that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

technique.caption: Technique
technique.description: The Technique object describes the technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

sub_technique.caption: Sub Technique
sub_technique.description: The Sub Technique object describes the sub technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

tactic.caption: Tactic
tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

finding_info.caption: Finding Information
finding_info.name: finding_info
finding_info.description: The Finding Information object describes metadata related to a security finding generated by a security tool or system.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the reported finding.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the reported finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the reported finding.

types.caption: Types
types.description: One or more types of the reported finding.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: The MITRE ATT&CK® technique and associated tactics related to the finding.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.description: The analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the finding or conclusion.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the finding was created.

data_sources.caption: Data Sources
data_sources.description: A list of data sources utilized in generation of the finding.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.

It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

kill_chain.caption: Kill Chain
kill_chain.description: The Cyber Kill Chain® provides a detailed description of each phase and its associated activities within the broader context of a cyber attack.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.

It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

product_uid.caption: Product Identifier
product_uid.description: The unique identifier of the product that reported the finding.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Other analytics related to this finding.

related_events.caption: Related Events
related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing to the source of the finding.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.

It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was created.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.

It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

database.caption: Database
database.name: database
database.description: The database object is used for databases which are typically datastore services that contain an organized collection of structured and unstructured data or a types of data.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The database name, ordinarily as assigned by a database administrator.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the database in bytes.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The database type.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description that pertains to the object or event. See specific usage.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the database.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the database belongs.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the database type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the database was known to have been created.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the database.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the database was known to have been created.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the database.

dns_query.caption: DNS Query
dns_query.name: dns_query
dns_query.description: The DNS query object represents a specific request made to the Domain Name System (DNS) to retrieve information about a domain or perform a DNS operation. This object encapsulates the necessary attributes and methods to construct and send DNS queries, specify the query type (e.g., A, AAAA, MX). Defined by D3FEND d3f:DNSLookup.

type.caption: Resource Record Type
type.description: The type of resource records being queried. See RFC1035. For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, and NS.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname or domain being queried. For example: www.example.com

class.caption: Resource Record Class
class.description: The class of resource records being queried. See RFC1035. For example: IN.

opcode.caption: DNS Opcode
opcode.description: The DNS opcode specifies the type of the query message.

opcode_id.caption: DNS Opcode ID
opcode_id.description: The DNS opcode ID specifies the normalized query message type.

3.caption: Reserved
3.description: Reserved, not used

6.caption: DSO Message
6.description: DNS Stateful Operations (DSO)

1.caption: Inverse Query
1.description: Inverse query, obsolete

2.caption: Status
2.description: Server status request

5.caption: Update
5.description: Dynamic DNS update

packet_uid.caption: Packet UID
packet_uid.description: The DNS packet identifier assigned by the program that generated the query. The identifier is copied to the response.

evidences.caption: Evidence Artifacts
evidences.name: evidences
evidences.description: A collection of evidence artifacts associated to the activity/activities that triggered a security detection.

data.caption: Data
data.description: Additional evidence data that is not accounted for in the specific evidence attributes. Use only when absolutely necessary.

process.caption: Process
process.description: Describes details about the process associated to the activity that triggered the detection.

file.caption: File
file.description: Describes details about the file associated to the activity that triggered the detection.

query.caption: DNS Query
query.description: Describes details about the DNS query associated to the activity that triggered the detection.

connection_info.caption: Connection Info
connection_info.description: Describes details about the network connection associated to the activity that triggered the detection.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about the API call associated to the activity that triggered the detection.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: Describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity that triggered the detection.

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: Describes details about the destination of the network activity that triggered the detection.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: Describes details about the source of the network activity that triggered the detection.

user.caption: User
user.name: user
user.description: The User object describes the characteristics of a user/person or a security principal. Defined by D3FEND d3f:UserAccount.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The username. For example, janedoe1.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the user. For example, System, AWS IAM User, etc.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The domain where the user is defined. For example: the LDAP or Active Directory domain.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique user identifier. For example, the Windows user SID, ActiveDirectory DN or AWS user ARN.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit related to the user.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The administrative groups to which the user belongs.

3.caption: System
3.description: System account. For example, Windows computer accounts with a trailing dollar sign ($).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: User
1.description: Regular user account.

2.caption: Admin
2.description: Admin/root user account.

full_name.caption: Full Name
full_name.description: The full name of the person, as per the LDAP Common Name attribute (cn).

account.caption: Account
account.description: The user's account or the account associated with the user.

credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID
credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

ldap_person.caption: LDAP Person
ldap_person.description: The additional LDAP attributes that describe a person.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate user identifier. For example, the Active Directory user GUID or AWS user Principal ID.

kb_article.caption: KB Article
kb_article.name: kb_article
kb_article.description: The KB Article object contains metadata that describes the patch or update.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size in bytes for the kb article.

os.caption: OS
os.description: The operating system the kb article applies.

title.caption: Title
title.description: The title of the kb article.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product details the kb article applies.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the kb article.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the kb article.

classification.caption: Classification
classification.description: The vendors classification of the kb article.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The date the kb article was released by the vendor.

is_superseded.caption: The patch is superseded.
is_superseded.description: The kb article has been replaced by another.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The kb article link from the source vendor.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The date the kb article was released by the vendor.

api.caption: API
api.name: api
api.description: The API, or Application Programming Interface, object represents  information pertaining to an API request and response.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the API service.

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: Details pertaining to the API request.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The information pertaining to the API service.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The information pertaining to the API group.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: Details pertaining to the API response.

web_resource.caption: Web Resource
web_resource.name: web_resource
web_resource.description: The Web Resource object describes characteristics of a web resource that was affected by the activity/event.

data.caption: Data
data.description: Details of the web resource, e.g, file details, search results or application-defined resource.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the web resource.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The web resource type as defined by the event source.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: Description of the web resource.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the web resource.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels/tags associated to a resource.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL pointing towards the source of the web resource.

finding.caption: Finding
finding.name: finding
finding.description: The Finding object describes metadata related to a security finding generated by a security tool or system.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the reported finding.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the reported finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the reported finding.

types.caption: Types
types.description: One or more types of the reported finding.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the finding was created.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The time when the finding was first observed.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The time when the finding was most recently observed.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

product_uid.caption: Product Identifier
product_uid.description: The unique identifier of the product that reported the finding.

related_events.caption: Related Events
related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing to the source of the finding.

supporting_data.caption: Supporting Data
supporting_data.description: Additional data supporting a finding as provided by security tool

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was first observed.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was created.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was most recently observed.

tls_extension.caption: TLS Extension
tls_extension.name: tls_extension
tls_extension.description: The TLS Extension object describes additional attributes that extend the base Transport Layer Security (TLS) object.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The data contains information specific to the particular extension type.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The TLS extension type. For example: Server Name.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The TLS extension type identifier. See The Transport Layer Security (TLS) extension page.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: maximum_fragment_length
1.description: The Maximum Fragment Length Negotiation extension.

10.caption: supported_groups
10.description: The Supported Groups extension.

5.caption: status_request
5.description: The Certificate Status Request extension.

14.caption: use_srtp
